sen.j: 平 知度（たいら の とものり、生年不詳 - 1183年6月2日（寿永2年5月11日 (旧暦)））は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tomonori (year of birth unknown - June 2, 1183) was busho (a Japanese military commander) at the end of Heian period.
TAIRA no Tomonori (year of birth unknown - June 2, 1183) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) lived in the end of Heian period.
sen.cmt: "busho"に冠詞，平安時代末期の前置詞をin に替え，livedを加えました。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tomonori (date of birth unknown - June 2, 1183) was a busho (a Japanese military commander) who lived during the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 内容を多少修正しました。

sen.e: He was the seventh son of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was the seventh son of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was the seventh son of TAIRA no Kiyomori.
He was Mikawa no kuni no kami (Governor of Mikawa Province).
He was the Mikawa no kuni no kami (Governor of Mikawa Province).
He was the Mikawa no kuni no kami (Governor of Mikawa Province).

sen.j: 大将軍の一人として富士川・長良川の両合戦に従軍。
sen.e: He served as one of Daishogun (commanders-in-chief) in the Battles of Fujigawa and Nagaragawa.
He served in two battles, the Battles of Fujigawa and the Battles of Nagaragawa, as one of Daishogun (commanders-in-chief).
sen.cmt: 原文と訳文が若干異なるため書き換えました。
sen.e: He served in two battles, the Battles of Fujigawa and the Battles of Nagaragawa, as one of Daishogun (commanders-in-chief).

sen.j: さらに源義仲を討つために北陸に下向するが、倶利伽羅峠の戦いで討死した。
sen.e: Although he went down to the Hokuriku region to hunt down and kill MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, Tomonori himself died in the Battle of the Kurikara Pass.
He went to the Hokuriku region for hunting down and killing MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, but he was killed in the Battle of the Kurikara Pass.
sen.cmt: 「下向する」を用語サイトを参考に変更しました。「討つため」の前置詞と「討死した」の表現を変更しました。
sen.e: He went to the Hokuriku region for hunting down and killing MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, but he was killed in the Battle of the Kurikara Pass.
